intro: Cleoserrata serrata, commonly known as the serrated cleome, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and distinctive serrated leaf margins. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of yellow, orange, or red, which bloom throughout the growing season. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. Cleoserrata serrata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and relatively low maintenance requirements.
